headline: Best Oven Baked French Toast
description: This baked French toast is lightly spiced with a buttery combination of cinnamon and brown sugar, perfect for a special brunch, and can be made ahead.
name: Best Oven Baked French Toast

recipeInstructions.text: Pour melted butter into a 9x13-inch baking dish; grease the sides with butter and let remaining butter sit in the bottom of the dish.
Sprinkle brown sugar and cinnamon evenly over melted butter. Arrange two layers of bread slices on top.
Whisk eggs, milk, and salt together in a bowl; pour over bread slices. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: There was not enough liquid to actually soak all of the bread. We wound up making almost double the mixture. It tasted great, but if we make it again I think I would dip the bread into the egg mixture first rather than just pouring it over.

There wasn't quite enough custard to really soak into the top layer, so it was a little dry. That may have been my fault - I left my bread out on the counter to dry for the day, so it may have been too dry for the volume of custard. I also added a handful of rather elderly raisins to the bottom and between the layers, so they may have soaked up some of the moisture as well. It was tasty enough. Next time, I might use mixed spice or cake spice (or just add some nutmeg and ginger to the cinnamon).
Step by step instructions makes this oven baked French toast easy peasy.

Yeah, pretty much rediculously delicious! My impatience forced me to make and bake without the fridge time and still soooo good! I also added a sprinkler of turbinato to the top prior to baking to give it a little pop.
So easy and delicious! The second time making it I added a layer of sliced Granny Smith apples before the bread. Perfection!
The recipe is awesome and easy. I did add some raisins and crushed walnuts between the slices and on top. Homemade maple syrup and whipped cream top it off.
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??

I really wanted to love this as I made it for a snow day treat. I practically had to choke it down, WAY too much sugar and the bottom layer was a complete overly sweet mushy mess while the top layer was bland, dry, and too crunchy on the edges. This was a one and done for me.

I thought the idea of reviewing a recipe was to review THIS recipe as is. If you modify it, you’re not reviewing this recipe, you’re reviewing your own. Submit your recipe and let others try it and review it. It’s not fair to this chef to change his/her creation.

I made this for Christmas morning breakfast. It is so quick and simple but absolutely decadent and delicious! It is a big hit in our household of French Toast lovers! I used Hawaiian Sweet bread and added some chopped pecans. SOOOO good!
I added walnuts and raisins, it was delicious!!!

The ratios in this recipe are okay but the order of operations is not. I was in a rush and started setting it up without thinking. You don’t put all the flavor on the bottom then cover it up. You need to mix everything together or the sugar will just sit on the bottom...... The butter works fine on the bottom to keep it from sticking but the sugar and cinnamon needs to be mixed with the egg and milk mixture.... I had to get stupid with things to fix it after I’d already added the sugar to the butter on the bottom. Now I have to add more to the recipe when I wake up in the AM because the top is all dry. I had to work from the bottom up to make it mix.

Super easy make ahead recipe. I add a sprinkle of cinnamon on top, too. I've made it as is, with apple slices, with blueberries...going to add pralines next. Thank you for this quick and versatile French toast recipe! My family absolutely loves it!

The next time I make this I plan on using much less brown sugar, 3/4 of a cup is too much. The other difference is I will pour everything over the top not leave the brown sugar and cinnamon on the bottom.

I also put apples on the bottom (flipped it over when I served it), and applesauce in between the layers. It was quite soft or soggy when I served it right out of the oven. My family enjoyed it more on day two because it was firmer and the flavour was great.

Delicious! I pretty much made it as-is, but I did add a little vanilla to the milk/egg mixture, and I used some of the Splenda brown sugar as well. I also used cinammon/raisin swirl bread. It was so good! Next time I will probably increase the eggs by one and the milk to 3/4 cup so the liquid is a little more evenly distributed.
Made this on Christmas Eve along with a crust less quiche. It was delicious and super easy to just pop in the oven while we opened gifts. I see this returning next year for sure.
Is good every time. Better cold the next day. Like a bread pudding.
I have been making this for awhile now. It is so easy to make and a big hit for sleepovers. My whole family loves this breakfast dish and I almost always have all the ingredients!
Delicious!!!

I made this a couple times. First time I didn’t let it sit in the refrigerator overnight. I also used challah instead of white bread. It was still really good. I tried it again today, but I did put it in the refrigerator overnight. I also changed it up a bit. After I put the brown sugar and butter I also put down a layer of chopped pecans and a layer of sliced bananas, I used about 4 large ones sliced thick. It was AMAZING.

I thought this was excellent. I used thick sliced bread. I didn’t have brown sugar, so I just used white sugar. I also dipped the bread in the egg mixture as another reviewer had suggested. I then sprinkled white sugar and cinnamon on the top of the bread slices before putting them in the oven. I did not let it sit overnight, I just went ahead and popped it in the oven. I only had to bake it about 25 minutes. This tasted just like French toast.
Easy even if you don't soak overnight! Family liked it.

One very essential step was omitted: You must flip the bread halfway through baking. It will cook unevenly without. Keep an eye on it while in the oven.

If using a thicker sliced bread (i.e. brioche) be prepared for a longer baking time (45 minutes to an hour).

As recommended by another reviewer, I added very thinly sliced apples. Turned out beautifully! Syrup was unnecessary.

I feel like the technique is pretty solid, but this was way too sweet for my personal preference. I look forward to playing around with the recipe though so that I can find a personal best version for me. I halved the recipe, but needed to use an extra egg and about 1/8 cup of milk. It was otherwise challenging to cover all of the bread with the egg mixture.
I was excited to make this as it seemed simple. I followed the directions. We were disappointed as it was overwhelmingly sweet.

I made this for brunch for 8 people (after reviewing many recipes and tips from people who made similar version); I had to double the recipe; I also cut sugar down a little and increased milk (mixed 1/2 skim with 1/2 10% cream); added orange zest plus squeezed 1/2 orange for juice. I made morning of, and let it sit for about 3 hours. AMAZING AND LOVED BY ALL OF US :) Will definitely be made many times over as a family treat! Thanks for the recipe :)
Added a teaspoon of vanilla extract, made the flavor more pronounced and sweet. Recommend trying it!
Easy to make and very tasty.

Made two batches for having my family over for breakfast, one batch with the brown sugar and one without for a more savory french toast. Both turned out well and were a big hit! I added an extra 2 eggs and 1/4c milk to each recipe because with the 6 eggs and 1/2c some of the bread was still a bit dry, but 8 eggs and 3/4c for each batch was perfect! I think the size and density of your bread probably makes a difference, I used bigger and denser bread (Nature's Own Perfectly Crafted Thick Sliced White Bread is what I used) than a lot of sandwich bread. 

The one without brown sugar was a tiny bit heavy on butter, it was still good and was still eaten and enjoyed, the butter flavor was just a bit strong. Next time I make it without brown sugar I'll probably do 3/4 a stick of butter instead of a whole stick.
Added dusting of confectioners sugar. Butter/sugar base made it very dark but the sugar dusting worked and the taste was excellent. Very easy to make ahead
I used Texas toast bread
Didn’t change anything. It turned out fabulous, the whole family loved it!
My family loves it! I do add half a teaspoon of vanilla but other than that the dish is delish.
Easy to make and very tasty.

I made this twice - once for Thanksgiving breakfast and the other for Black Friday breakfast. the family LOVED it! My nieces said it tasted like a cinnamon roll. I used Canyon Bakehouse cinnamon raisin bread and it went perfectly with the recipe.
VERY sweet. The brown sugar gets a bit crunchy at the edges baby we added some butter between the slices to make it a little more soft while eating.
This is my second time making this recipe and my coworkers and I love it.
This was great! I initially thought it might be dry due to only 1/2 cup of milk..but it wasn't! The butter and cinnamon sugar mixture on the bottom make this very cinnamon roll like. It's a keeper.
Very tasty, my church worship team enjoyed them
This was not a winner in my house.

Sunday morning, I want to make my kids a nice breakfast I had whole wheat potato bread that needed to be used. So I decided to give it another shot at making baked french toast, after not being so successful in the past. I have a recipe for brioche bread baked french toast that I know my son enjoys, but I knew that the recipe was too decadent for plain old potato bread. Well, I must say I was pleasantly surprised! This recipe is a keeper for sure. I did not make any changes. The only thing I did not do was let it sit overnight as suggested. This came out perfect!

I made this for a Girl’s Brunch. I did add more cinnamon but that was my only tweak, besides not soaking it overnight. It was a big hit. Every bite was gone. It is a bit sweet but that’s what you want from French Toast.

We'll definitely make this recipe again. Without changes, it'd be too sweet for us (hence the 4 stars). We made a double batch and used 1/2 c butter, and 3/4 c brown sugar, added an extra 1/2 c milk plus 1/2 T vanilla and used 18 slices of Sara Lee artesano bread. we used 1 - 9"x13" and 1 - 9"x9" baking dish. We added 1/2 of the cinnamon to the butter and brown sugar and the other 1/2 to the batter. 2 layers of 5 slices of bread each were used in the larger pan, 4 pieces (3 whole and 1 slice cut in half) in the smaller pan. We prepped in the evening, refrigerated about 9 hours, then baked. French toast was flipped onto serving trays and cut into 8 servings for each of the larger pans. Served alongside sausages and fruit. No one added syrup.
Made this the "morning of" for a spring break play date and it was great. Next time I'll try it the night before.
Awesome it my first time make this recipe for Aaliyyah she is the youngest of my clan and she said they were awesome. Thanks was another to get protein in to her body

This was my first time making baked french toast and it was a great success. My modifications were as follows: Allow the butter to melt in the oven during the preheat time. I sliced the bread into strips. I added the cinnamon to the egg mixture and softened cream cheese cut into cubes to the saturated bread. I did not allow to sit overnight. I baked it covered for 20 minutes. I poured mixed berries over the top and cooked uncovered for the last 10 minutes. This gave it a stuffed flavor without all the work. My family loved it!

Delicious as is, however I did "tweak" it. 
First I used Texas Toast Bread (I trimmed off the crust so it would look pretty)
I melted 1 stick of butter, then added 1 cup of light brown sugar. I poured that mixture into a 9X13 pan. In another bowl I mixed 4 eggs, 1 cup of whole milk, 1 tsp. Vanilla. I layered the bread on top of mixture, poured half of the egg mixture, I then made another layer adding the other half of egg mixture. Covered and placed in fridge overnight. In the morning I placed it covered in the oven 350° for 30 mins, removed the cover and baked for an additional 20 mins untill the top was light brown. Cool and sprinkled with powdered sugar. Theres no need for syrup as the butter/brown sugar is sweet enough. Just love!

Absolute love it, but I just add my own twist. Between 2 layers of bread, I add chocolate chips and sliced bananas. Taste to dye for!!! I also want to add, I didn’t have time to do it overnight, I cooked it right away!
Look no further. Easy, delicious, never fails.
Very good different than regular french toast.
This recipe is about to get a workout lol got 120 french toast I got to make tomorrow for a banquet.

No complaints about the flavors, though next time I would change the technique. Instead of adding butter then brown sugar, I think I will mix the two ahead of time so the sugar is more evenly distributed in the pan. Then I will likely dip the bread in the sugar on both sides, again to even things out. I opted to do the prep just 30 minutes before popping it in the oven but I’m sure the overnight method helps everything soak into the bread nicely. This made for a good brunch item!
I will definitely make this again. I added softened cream cheese & maple syrup to egg mixture which gave it a sweeter taste.

I thought brown sugar on the bottom was grainy instead of more like a syrup. If I made again I would heat the butter and sugar on the stove with a little water to melt the sugar better. Overall I might make again if melting the brown sugar makes the overall dish more appealing.
Good flavor but didn't like the slices sticking together. At one point it look like pudding, so I stuck it in oven additional 10 minutes
Will make it again

I halved the recipe, cubed the bread and dipped them in the egg spread before placing them in the tray. Refrigerated overnight with it clingwrapped, then baked it in the morning for about half an hour. The smell of cinnamon baked bread was lovely but the result was a tad dry, perhaps placing it overnight in the fridge dried it out much? I don't know, taste was alright, the healthier version than pan-fried french toast! The top was crispy so that was the plus. :)
Used coconut oil instead of butter. Used less sugar. Sprinkled blueberries and homemade granola on top. Everyone loved it. Yum!

I used sliced brioche bread with chocolate chips from Aldi's. The grandkids loved it!!!!!
I get asked to make this all the time for church functions. It is a big hit everytime!

I made this dish I add chopped pecans and it was delicious. The only thing I would do after I ate it it was I i would single layer the bread so all would become crunchy because I prefer my food not be soggy thanks for sharing the recipe.

I used Brioche loaf bread (very soft/sweet), and per reviews: a thin layer of cinnamon applesauce between bread layers and served upside down for a cinnamon/sugar topping. YUM!! Only reason it gets 4* is bcs. it turns out more like bread pudding instead of french toast. Really good though.
Used an extra egg as suggested. Kids loved it.

The recipe is really good as written, but the brown sugar and butter didn’t get gooey like I was expecting them to. I think if I made this again, I would melt the butter and brown sugar in a sauce pan for a couple minutes before stirring in the cinnamon and pouring into the baking dish.
Sure I will make it again.. so easy and delicious

This recipe really didn't turn out for me. I followed the recipe and unfortunately after refrigerating it overnight and then cooking it, the bottom portion was completely soggy and the top was a bit too dry. It just really didn't work. I won't be making this again.

Served this to my husband and a friend who came for brunch. I added toasted chopped walnuts to the bottom layer and used an extra egg and a little 1/2 & 1/2 because my bread was really dried out when I went to assemble it. I baked it at a little higher temperature (375 degrees) since I wanted it to be nice and brown on the bottom. I served it with apple pie filling that I thinned down with a little water and lemon juice. It was FABULOUS and not overly sweet. Friend took recipe home and leftovers for her husband.

I cut off most of the bottom crust of French bread and tore into pieces. I didn’t add cinnamon to butter/brown sugar mixture, I put it in the egg and milk. I used half and half since I didn’t have milk. This was the best French toast ever, the butter/brown sugar came up thru the bread and also had a caramely bottom.
I’m making it again, this time for Easter brunch.

My husband (who usually sticks to the basics) & our 9 year old granddaughter made this the evening. All four grandchildren (age 9 to 3 years) loved it; but who wouldn't like all the sweetness & bread. These are the modifications we made:
1) Used 9 slices of Dave's Killer Bread - Organic 21 whole grains & seeds
2) Didn't melt the butter, just used soft butter
3) Put cream cheese chunks between the bread layers
4) Used cream instead of milk
5) Covered with foil for 30 minutes of baking, then uncovered and baked an additional 15 minutes or so, until well browned. I'm going to try and bake 15 minutes covered & 15 minutes uncovered next time.

Followed advice to half by using 8x8 pan. I used a panettone for the bread. For me, it took 4 eggs. I added nutmeg, cardamom and some sugar to the eggs too. Will definitely make again. I can only conclude that the 1 star reviewer made a mistake in the cooking. It definitely tasted like french toast to me. I'm already planning for a 'stuffing' between the 2 bread layers.

Made it for bruch with my ladies. I was worried about dryness and couldnt process how the flavor on the bottom would get to the top of the dish so I modified-
1. As other reviewers said I added an extra egg a d more milk. I used 1/4 cup of half n half.
2. I made extra butter and after pouring the recipe amount in the pan, I added another 3/4 cup of brown sugar to the butter and used a brush to brush the top of the bread slices.
3. I refrigerated as instructed. After baking I added 2 bananas to the butter and brown sugar and cooked on stove top. I brushed the top again with sugar mixture and put bananas on top along with candied pecans that I had on hand. I left extra syrup on side. 

Results...dayumm delicious!
I would make it again. Its a great make ahead breakfast for a crowd; just had scrambled eggs on the side.

This was really yummy! My family was looking at me like a crazy person because I was making French toast in the oven. My sister decided to “make her own” as she was concerned about how mine would come out, however, after tasting mine she said can I have some of yours, yours tastes way better. Lol!!!

Yummy! I cut the recipe in half, only did 1 layer of bread (6 slices) added a tsp of vanilla, and only let it sit in fridge for 30 minutes, and it turned out awesome! I'm going to try it overnight for Christmas breakfast!
I added some chopped pecans to the brown sugar mix and substituted 1/2 cup Bailey's Irish Cream for the milk. It was well received by my company.
Very good and easy to make.

I don't put it in the fridge at night, i make it the morning of. I also sprinkle brown sugar on the top as well as more cinnamon after I've poured the eggs and milk over the bread. My kids and husband LOVE it!!!!
Very good, will make again

I love make-ahead food for holidays. Made this for Easter brunch. Prepared it the night before, following the recipe exactly. Threw it in the oven after mass. It came out great! Everyone loved it. Rave reviews from all. Will definitely be in our next brunch rotation!

Very nice. I didn't let it soak overnight because I used thin, white sandwich bread (Pepperidge farm white) that I had leftover from making Thanksgiving stuffing. I reduced the brown sugar to about 1/3 cup and it was still terrific. I cooked it uncovered for a few minutes at the end. Yum.
I added extra cinnamon because I love it! Everything else stayed the same and it was wonderful! I will make this again and again!
My husband absolutely loves it!!! Looking forward to making for my grandchildren.

I added a sprinkle of nutmeg, but otherwise followed the recipe. While the top looks not done, when you flip it over on the plate, it looks delicious. It tastes even better. 

When I baked it I did leave it covered with aluminum foil for the first 25 minutes and then baked it another 10-15 without the foil. 

Will definitely make this again!!

ginny thank you for this recipe. i have made this several times, once as written and then the last couple of times i add an extra egg and milk plus a dash of vanilla. my grandaughter has been requesting that i make it every time she is here.
I made the recipe exactly as written and it was a big hit. Very easy to make, best part made it the night before then just throw in the oven the next day.

We use this every Christmas brunch. We have made some minor adjustments when putting it together. Instead of all the melted butter and brown sugar mix on the bottom, we use a little more than half on the bottom, and brush the middle and top layers with the butter and sprinkle remaining brown sugar, than pour the eggs over. I also take one additional whipped egg and brush all the sides and corners of the top layer of bread.
New favorite for my family
Our family loved this for a family brunch we had.

The only two days of the year I cook a big breakfast for my family are Thanksgiving Day and Christmas morning. My kids always request this casserole. I add extra cinnamon and white chocolate chips and it tastes like a big cinnamon roll. I covered the casserole for the first 15 minutes so that the top didn't get too browned. I baked it uncovered for the remaining 15 minutes.

Made this exactly as written (scaled down to family size) This was delicious! No need IMHO for syrup just gobs of butter. My very picky and hater of sweet stuff husband had two helpings. I will definitely make this again.

I thought it was very good with the adaptations I made to recipe. I sprayed the pan with nonstick spray first to make sure cleanup was easy (which it was). The bread I had on hand was homemade sourdough, which worked well for the texture of this recipe. I mixed the butter, sugar, and cinnamon together, and added 2 tsp of pure vanilla extract, and divided them between the bottom and the between the bread layers. I increased the milk to 3/4 cup. I added a topping of cinnamon and sugar lightly sprinkled across the top. I did not wait overnight; I just let it rest for 10 minutes before baking. I baked it at 375 for 40 minutes. After baking, I inverted it onto the serving platter. The only change I'd make to my method would be to put all of the butter/sugar/cinnamon on the bottom instead of dividing it, so it would be even more of a syrupy crust. I had initially thought people would take one slice off at a time, but they stuck together well, so we all just cut our own slices, instead of trying to make it fit individual slices of bread. Will definitely make it again.

I made this in the morning, so no sitting overnight, but I used thin sliced bread. I used only about 3/4 of a stick of butter, I drizzled melted butter and added a little brown sugar and cinnamon between layers of bread, and a little more brown sugar and cinnamon on top. I added a little vanilla and maple extract to the egg/milk mix. Baked for 40 min, then turned over and baked for another 10-15 min. (We don't like soggy French toast)

Big hit and easy to prepare for Mother's Day! I used some country french bread from Costco and only a teaspoon of cinnamon (personal preference). Let sit for 3 hrs before baking. I left everything else the same. It was delicious. I removed the bread from the 13 X 9, flipped it over (butter/sugar or brown side up) onto a serving plate. The pieces that were not in the butter/sugar mixture needed a little extra maple syrup per some peoples request. Served with some maple sausage links I cooked in the oven at the same time I cooked the french toast. Also served with some cut up peaches and strawberries on the side.

I have made "overnight French toast" before and by far this came out way better. I made minor modifications based on previous reviews. I used thinly sliced challah bread (pre-sliced from supermarket bakery) in a 9x 13 pan. I also added the extra egg, added a splash half and half and a splash of vanilla creamer to the egg mixture with the 1/2 cup of milk. I figured a little extra liquid would be ok with the extra egg. I then put fresh blueberries in between the 2 layers of bread. I did let it sit overnight and next am sprinkled a pinch of Brown sugar and cinnamon on top prior to baking. I would say it took about 35 min to bake but it was perfect, not soggy at all. I cut the bread slices in half, and flipped the half slices over into a platter (brown sugar side up) drizzled a bit of warm syrup and some more fresh blueberries. It served a group of 10 ladies with some other brunch items. Received many compliments especially from a friend who makes these types of dishes all the time.

I forgot to buy brown sugar, but this honestly was so good it wasn't even needed. I also didn't measure out the cinnamon (I do that sometimes). I just added it until it looked good enough to me, which was more than the recipe called for. Doing so added a really good cinnamon flavor. The bottom was crunchy, almost like it was caramelized, but the rest of it was soft and the combo was perfect. I added about a tabIespoon of vanilla into the egg mixture as well. I also cut the French toast into French toast sticks. It was a huge hit at our Easter party. The entire pan was devoured in 30 minutes.

I made this exactly as the recipe stated. It was a big thumbs up from the family. No syrup needed. I also tried putting cinnamon applesauce in between two of them. They liked it better without the applesauce. Will make this again.

I made this for my family for Christmas morning breakfast. It was a big hit! However, I had to cook it longer than suggested to make sure the eggs were cooked. I also modified it slightly as other reviewers had suggested and I spread a thin layer of cinnamon applesauce between the bread layers and then sprinkled a little extra cinnamon on top. I also dipped each piece of bread in the egg mixture (like regular french toast) and then poured the remaining egg mixture on. I think next time I will use chunks of bread because I think it would fit into the pan better. Overall, this was a big hit!

It was OK. I made it exactly as is except I cut up the bread and tossed it in the milk mixture instead of pouring it over the top. It was a little too rich for my tastes but the kids loved it! I don't know if I will make this again.
I made this with homemade cinnamon raisin bread and didn't leave it overnight because I forgot. Very tasty
